channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Medical supplies in great need as aid flows into Myanmar after earthquake
item.description: Emergency aid has streamed into Southeast Asia in the two days since a massive earthquake struck Myanmar and Thailand.
item.content:encoded:
Emergency aid has streamed into Southeast Asia in the two days since a massive earthquake struck Myanmar and Thailand.

(Image credit: Haymhan Aung/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As measles cases rise, some parents become vaccine enthusiasts
item.description: Vaccine hesitancy has been growing in the U.S. in recent years. But as Texas measles cases rise and other states report outbreaks too, some parents want their kids to get their shots early.
item.content:encoded:
Vaccine hesitancy has been growing in the U.S. in recent years. But as Texas measles cases rise and other states report outbreaks too, some parents want their kids to get their shots early.

(Image credit: Karl Tapales)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Trump won't rule out military force to take Greenland
item.description: In an interview with NBC News, Trump refused to rule out military force to acquire Greenland. His remarks come a day after Vice President JD Vance's scaled back visit to the island.
item.content:encoded:
In an interview with NBC News, Trump refused to rule out military force to acquire Greenland. His remarks come a day after Vice President JD Vance's scaled back visit to the island.

(Image credit: Jim Watson/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Rosie the Riveters honored for service in WWII
item.description: The National World War Two Museum and the Gary Sinise Foundation celebrate the trailblazing women who worked in the American defense industry in the 1940s, and preserve their stories for future generations.
item.content:encoded:
The National World War Two Museum and the Gary Sinise Foundation celebrate the trailblazing women who worked in the American defense industry in the 1940s, and preserve their stories for future generations.

(Image credit: Emily Kask)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Police say ICE tactics are eroding public trust in local law enforcement
item.description: Local police leaders have feared the erosion of public trust as a result of the Trump administration's immigration enforcement efforts. Many officials say they're seeing signs that's happening.
item.content:encoded:
Local police leaders have feared the erosion of public trust as a result of the Trump administration's immigration enforcement efforts. Many officials say they're seeing signs that's happening.

(Image credit: Matt McClain)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Academy apologizes for not adequately supporting Oscar-winning Palestinian director
item.description: The apology appeared after a wave of online protest against the Academy — first for not responding to Ballal's attack, and then for not naming him and his film directly in its initial statement.
item.content:encoded:
The apology appeared after a wave of online protest against the Academy — first for not responding to Ballal's attack, and then for not naming him and his film directly in its initial statement.

(Image credit: Leo Correa)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: White House Correspondents' dinner cancels comedian Amber Ruffin's appearance
item.description: Amber Ruffin had been scheduled to perform at the prestigious gathering of political journalists on April 26 in Washington, D.C.
item.content:encoded:
Amber Ruffin had been scheduled to perform at the prestigious gathering of political journalists on April 26 in Washington, D.C.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: FCC chair opens investigation into Disney and ABC over DEI practices
item.description: FCC chair Brendan Carr said he wants a review all of Disney's DEI practices — both past and present — to determine whether the company has ever violated any FCC regulations.
item.content:encoded:
FCC chair Brendan Carr said he wants a review all of Disney's DEI practices — both past and present — to determine whether the company has ever violated any FCC regulations.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Delta plane and Air Force jet ordered to maneuver to avoid collision near DCA airport
item.description: A Delta passenger plane and an Air Force jet flew narrowly close to one another outside Washington, D.C., on Friday, prompting a collision warning and "corrective instructions" from air traffic controllers.
item.content:encoded:
A Delta passenger plane and an Air Force jet flew narrowly close to one another outside Washington, D.C., on Friday, prompting a collision warning and "corrective instructions" from air traffic controllers.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Photos: See the aftermath of the earthquake in Myanmar and Thailand
item.description: The first shipments of international aid arrived at the airport in the former capital, Yangon. They came from neighboring China and from India and included search and rescue and medical teams, as well as blankets, and other provisions.
item.content:encoded:
The first shipments of international aid arrived at the airport in the former capital, Yangon. They came from neighboring China and from India and included search and rescue and medical teams, as well as blankets, and other provisions.

(Image credit: Lillian Suwanrumpha)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff
